This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

unittitle.value: New York Exchange for Women's Work

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection consists of the records of the New York Exchange for Woman's Work, a charitable institution whose mission was to provide a retail outlet for the handiwork of needy consignors. The records include board minutes, corporate, financial, and real estate papers, advertising materials, clippings, photographs, and ephemera.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days. Researchers on site may print out unlimited copies from microfilm reader-printer machines at per-exposure rates. See guidelines in Reading Room for details.
This collection should be cited as The New York Exchange for Woman's Work Records, MS 446, the New-York Historical Society.

The collection also contains materials related to public relations efforts of the Exchange. Press releases and PR strategies mainly date from the 1990s, but newspaper clippings and advertisements have been preserved from as early as 1919.

corpname.value: New York Exchange for Woman's Work

dsc.value:
Series I: Minutes,1878-1997 Scope and Contents note

This series contains minutes of the monthly and annual meetings of the Board of Directors (also known as the Board of Managers) of the New York Exchange for Woman's Work. Also included are Annual Reports, minutes of subcommittees, and Annual Reports to the Federation of Woman's Exchanges.

 Minutes 1 1 1878, 1892-1893 Minutes 1 2 1901-1919 Minutes (Copies and Related Materials) 1 3 1878-1921 Minutes (Copies and Related Materials) 1 3 1878-1921 Minutes (Copies and Related Materials) 1 3 1878-1921 Minutes (Copies and Related Materials) 1 3 1878-1921 Minutes 1 4 1930-1935 Minutes 1 5 1936-February 1940 Minutes 1 6 March 1940-1943 Minutes 1 7 1944-February 1948 Minutes 2 1 March 1948-September 1950 Minutes 2 2 October 1950-February 1954 Minutes 2 3 March 1954-December 1955 Minutes 2 4 1956-February 1954 Minutes 2 5 March 1959-January 1961 Minutes 2 6 February 1961-February 1964 Minutes 2 7 March 1946-September 1966 Minutes 2 8 November 1966-February 1970 Minutes (Copies/Drafts) 2 9 1967-1970 Minutes 3 1 March 1970-February 1974 Minutes (Copies/Drafts) 3 2 1971-1974 Minutes 3 3 March 1974-1978 Minutes (Copies/Drafts) 3 4 1975-1978 Minutes 3 5 May 1978-May 1986 Minutes (Copies/Drafts) 3 6 1979-1984 Minutes (Copies/Drafts) 3 7 1985-1986 Minutes 3 8 1987-1989 Minutes 3 9 1990-1991 Minutes 4 1 1992-1997 Series II: Corporate Documents, 1887-1987, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains materials relating to the status of the Exchange as a not-for-profit corporation organized and existing under the laws of New York State.

 Certificate of Incorporation (Copies) 4 2 1887 Corporate Documents 4 3 1939 Stock Certificate Book 4 4 1939 Corporate Resolution 4 5 1941 By-Laws 4 6 1953, 1982 Board Members - Biographical Information 4 7 1927-1987, n.d. Series III: Financial Documents, 1911-1997, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains financial records of the Exchange, including materials relating to investments, taxes, accounting, and inventory. The series is divided into six subseries.

 Subseries 1: Investments and Bank Accounts,1911-1994 Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains materials relating to investment and bank accounts. Also included are financial statements and wills in which bequests to the Exchange were made.

 Account Book-Building and Endowment Fund 4 8 1911-1921 Investments 4 9 1911-1916, n.d. Wills (Bequests to Exchange) 4 10 1919-1978 Account Book 4 11 1972-1994 Bank Books 5 1 1956-1981 Financial Statements 5 2 1980 Subseries 2: Taxes, 1939-1997 Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains materials relating to the Exchange's tax-exempt status, as well as federal, state and local tax returns.

 IRS Letters Re:Tax Exempt Status 5 3 1939-1991 Correspondence/Forms Re:Tax-Exempt Status 5 4 1952-1986 Tax Returns 5 5 1977-1984 Real Estate Taxes 5 6 1979-1984 Real Estate Taxes 5 7 1992-1997 Subseries 3: Consignor and Inventory Records, 1957-1988, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains account records of consignors, the Exchange's policies for consignors, inventory records, and order forms for purchased goods.

 Consignor's Sundry Accounts [1] n.d. Consignor Records 1957-1989 Consignor Records 5 8 1963-1975 Inventory Records 5 9 n.d. Plum Pudding Works - Flyers and Orders 5 11 1987-1988 Facsimile of Printing Block for Consignor's Invoice 5 12 n.d. Inventory Records 15 1954-1989 Printing Block for Consignor's Invoice 17 n.d. Subseries 4: Accounting Records, 1938-1940 Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains records related to accounting, including materials related to a computerized bookkeeping system used by the organization in the 1980s.

 Account Book [2] 1938-1940. Computerized Bookkeeping System 5 12 1986-1988 Petty Cash Slip 5 13 1953 Subseries 5: Merchant Deposit Cards, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains the cards used to make imprints on credit card receipts.

 Merchant Deposit Summary Cards 5 14 n.d. Subseries 6: Employment Records, 1922-1981, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains materials related to paid employees of the Exchange.

 Employment 5 15 1922-1981, n.d. Series IV: Real Estate Documents, 1914-2000 Scope and Contents note

This series contains documents related to properties owned and leased by the Exchange. Included are mortgage agreements, leases, invoices for repairs, renovations, and rent, insurance policies, and related correspondence.

 Real Estate Documents 5 16 1914-1919 Minutes of Meetings Re: Sale of 334 Madison Avenue 5 17 1919 Real Estate Documents 5 18 1950-1934 Real Estate Documents 6 1 1935-1959 Real Estate Documents 6 2 1914-1919 Real Estate Documents 6 3 1970-1976 Real Estate Documents 6 4 1977-1978 Real Estate Documents 6 5 January-May 1979 Real Estate Documents 6 6 June-December 1979 Real Estate Documents 6 7 January-March 1980 Real Estate Documents 6 8 April-June 1980 Real Estate Documents 6 9 July-December 1980 Real Estate Documents 7 1 1981-1990 Real Estate Documents 7 2 1991-1997 Real Estate Documents 7 3 2000 Series V: Correspondence, 1878-2003 Scope and Contents note

This series contains letters written to and from the Board of Directors of the Exchange. Included are letters of resignation from Board members and staff, as well as letters from customers and donors. The materials are arranged chronologically.

 Correspondence 7 4 1878-1973 Correspondence 7 5 1981-2003, n.d. Series VI: Menus and Recipes, 1934-1980, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains menus from the Exchange Restaurant, cookbooks published by the Exchange and by other philanthropic organizations, and collections of recipes.

 Restaurant Menus 7 6 1934-1980, n.d. Cookbooks 7 7 n.d. Recipe Scrapbook 7 8 n.d. Recipe Cards 7 9 n.d. Recipe Scrapbook (disbound) 16 1 n.d. Series VII: Publications, 1894-1994, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains pamphlets and magazines published by the Exchange. Also included are materials which the staff used to generate ideas for issues of the Exchange Revue, and artwork which was used in the magazine.

 Catalogue 8 1 1894, n.d. Catalogue 8 2 1974-1923 Catalogue 8 3 1924-1926 Yearbook 8 4 1927-1929 Yearbook 8 5 1930-1934 Exchange Revue 8 6 1936-1937 Exchange Revue 8 7 1938 Exchange Revue 9 1 1939 Exchange Revue 9 2 1940 Exchange Revue 9 3 1941 Exchange Revue 9 4 1942 Exchange Revue 9 5 1970-1978 Exchange Revue 9 6 1979-1994 Exchange Revue Ideas 9 7 1953-1990 Artwork for Exchange Revue 9 8 n.d. Templates for Exchange Revue, Holiday 1990 15 1 1990 Series VIII: Advertising and Public Relations, 1918-2002 Scope and Contents note

This series contains advertising and public relations materials, as well as clippings, promotional materials, and business-related ephemera. It is divided into four subseries.

 Subseries 1: Advertisements, 1918-1998 Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains advertisements created by the Exchange. The earlier material (1918-1930) was originally placed in scrapbooks. These books have been disbound, but the materials remain in their original order. The later materials (1990-1998) consist of guidebooks and programs in which the Exchange placed advertisements.

 Advertisements 10 1 1918-1922 Advertisements 10 2 1922-1923 Advertisements 10 3 1924 Advertisements 10 4 1925 Advertisements 10 5 1925-1926 Advertisements 10 6 1927 Advertisements 10 7 1929-1930 Advertisements 10 8 1930 City Guide 10 9 1990 Blue Hill Troupe Programs 10 10 1996-1998 New York Quick Guide 10 11 1998 Subseries 2: Relations Materials, 1990-2002 Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains press releases, public relations handbooks, and public relations recommendations. It also contains press books which were originally housed in binders. These press books contain primarily clippings, press releases, and promotional items. The materials have been removed from the binders, but the original order has been preserved..

 Press Book 11 1 ca. 1990-1993 Press Book 11 2 1993-2002 Press Book 11 3 1993-2002 Press Releases 11 4 1986-1994 Public Relations Recommendations 11 5 1990-1995 Public Relations Handbooks 11 6 1991 Subseries 3: Clippings, ca. 1920-1999, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains newspaper and magazine clippings. Also included are magazines which featured stories about the Exchange. The album, 1965-1978, has been disbound and rehoused in its original order in Box 18. A facsimile of the bound volume is available in Box 16.

 Clippings [3] 1934 Album [4] 1965-1978 Clippings 11 7 1953-1989 Clippings 11 8 1990-1999, n.d. Town & Country Magazine 12 1 1991 People Magazine 12 2 1991 Facsimile of disbound volume 16 2 1965-1978 Scrapbook 18 1-4 ca. 1920-1953 Subseries 3: Promomotional Materials and Ephemera, 1988-1991, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains materials such as stationary, postcards, bookmarks, shopping bags, stickers, tissue paper, and business cards featuring the Exchange logo. Also included are materials related to the redesign of the Exchange logo in 1991, including artwork, order forms, invoices from printers, and a sign that hung outside the shop on East 60th Street.

 Promotional Materials 12 3 1988 Logo 12 4 c1991 Ephemera with New Logo 12 5 c1991 Brochures 12 7 c1990s Business Materials/Ephemera 12 8 n.d. Drawing, illustration, template for wrapping paper 15 3 n.d. Display items, matted drawings, illustrations 16 3 1991, n.d. Plexiglass sign unboxed n.d. Series IX: Fundraising, 1879-2000, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains materials relating to various fundraising activities of the Exchange, including the annual appeal and theater benefit, as well as in-store events.

 Fundraising Appeals/Benefits 12 9 1879-1936, n.d. Appeals/Benefits 12 10 1953-1991 Appeal Expense Records 12 11 1955-1960 Appeal Letter Ideas 12 12 ca. 1990s Mailings to Supporters 12 13 1981-2000 Beatrix Potter Event 12 14 1986-1988 Guest Book 13 1 n.d. Series X: Photographs and Video, 1981-1990, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains photographs of the interior and exterior of the Exchange shops, Restaurant, and offices at 539-541 Madison Avenue, 660 Madison Avenue, 1095 Third Avenue, and 149 East 60th Street. Many of the photographs depict the merchandise for sale at the Exchange. There are also photographs of board members, employees, and customers. In addition, there is a VHS cassette featuring a 1990 episode of "What It Takes," a local television program featuring the Executive Director of the Exchange, Catherine Dinehart.

 Photographs 13 2 n.d. Photographs (Proofs/Correspondence) 13 3 1981 Beatrix Potter Photographs 13 4 1981 Photo Album 13 1989 Photo Album 13 n.d. Video "What It Takes" T.V. 13 1990 Series XI: Historical Information, 1891-1998, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains information collected by the Exchange about its own historical development. It also includes a dissertation entitled "'Not A Lady Among Us': Entrepreneurial Philanthropy and Economic Independence as Expressed Through the Woman's Exchange Movement, 1832-1900," written by Kathleen Waters Sander on woman's exchanges in the United States (including the New York Exchange for Woman's Work), as well as correspondence relating to a book (The Business of Charity: The Woman's Exchange Movement, 1832-1900) written by Sander on the same topic.

 "Not A Lady Among Us"/The Business of Charity 14 1 1994-1998 Historical Notes/Essays 14 2 1891-1984, n.d. Notes for Historical Brochure 14 3 1990 Series XII: Other Exchanges and thw Federation of Woman's Exchanges, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains pamphlets created by other woman's exchanges, including the Peña-Peck House, the Baltimore Woman's Industrial Exchange, and the St. Louis Woman's Exchange. It also contains materials published by the Federation of Woman's Exchanges.

 Other Exchanges/Federation 14 4 n.d. Series XIII: In-Store Displays and Exhibits, 1879-2000, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series contains a number of matted photographs, advertisements, menus, and clippings which were used as part of an in-store exhibit, as well as framed photographs and other materials which were used to decorate the store.

 Matted oversize clippings 15 4 n.d. Photographs 16 4 ca. 1966, n.d. Displays 16 5 2000, n.d. Matted pamphlets and clippings, menu, note 16 6 1879-1992 Matted ephemera, advertisements, clippings, invitations 16 7 n.d. Photograph and document formerly adhered to Lippincott's plaque 16 8 1981, 1986, n.d. Documents removed from small picture frame 16 9 1991, n.d. Drawing, descriptive documents 16 10 n.d. Misc. exhibit labels 16 11 n.d. Color illustration of exhibit design "plaid stripes on columns and center" (rolled) 16 n.d. Color illustration of exhibit design (rolled) 16 n.d. Fabric swatches (in 2 rolls) 16 n.d. Plaque in appreciation of Mrs. William J. Lippincott 17 n.d.
